robo-fashion 1.1.0

This library employs builder and fluent design patterns to enable easy iteration and manipulation of Android sparse collections.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
com.bmd.android.collection.entry
Package containing classes defining the iterated entries mapping the specific Android sparse collection key and value pairs.
com.bmd.android.collection.filter
Package containing classes defining filtering of elements, keys and values.
com.bmd.android.collection.internal
Package containing internal implementations of public interfaces.
com.bmd.android.collection.iterator
Package containing classes defining the iterable wrapping the Android sparse collection objects.
com.bmd.android.collection.translator
Package containing classes defining transformation operations between elements, keys and values.
com.bmd.android.collection.utils
Utility classes package.
com.bmd.android.collection.v16
Main library package (supports API level >= 16).
com.bmd.android.collection.v18
Main library package (supports API level >= 18).
com.bmd.android.collection.v4
Main library package (supports API level >= 4).
This library employs builder and fluent design patterns to enable easy iteration and manipulation of Android sparse collections.

Usage examples

Example 1: simple iteration of a simple array map collection: 
    
        final SimpleArrayMap<String, String> array = new SimpleArrayMap<String, String>();

        // Fill with values...

        for (final SimpleArrayMapEntry<String, String> entry : AndroidCollections.iterate(array)) {

            System.out.println(entry);
        }
Example 2: filtered iteration of a simple array map collection (only keys starting with "a"): 
    
        final SimpleArrayMap<String, String> array = new SimpleArrayMap<String, String>();

        // Fill with values...

        AndroidCollections.iterate(array).only(new Filter<SimpleArrayMapEntry<String, String>>() {

                    @Override
                    public boolean matches(final SimpleArrayMapEntry<String, String> entry,
                            final int count, final int index) {

                        return entry.getKey().startsWith("a");
                    }
                }).forEach(new Action<SimpleArrayMapEntry<String, String>>() {

                    @Override
                    public void onNext(final SimpleArrayMapEntry<String, String> entry, final int count,
                            final int index) {

                        System.out.println(entry);
                    }
                });
Example 3: iterate a sparse array collection, except the last two elements, in the reverse order: 
    
        final SparseArray<String> array = new SparseArray<String>();

        // Fill with values...

        for (final SparseArrayEntry<String> entry :
                AndroidCollections.iterate(array).but().last(2).reverse()) {

            System.out.println(entry);
        }
Example 4: remove only elements with an odd key from a sparse array collection: 
    
        final SparseArray<String> array = new SparseArray<String>();

        // Fill with values...

        AndroidCollections.iterate(array).only(new Filter<SparseArrayEntry<String>>() {

                    @Override
                    public boolean matches(final SparseArrayEntry<String> entry, final int count,
                            final int index) {

                        return ((entry.getKey() & 0x1) != 0);
                    }
                }).remove();
Example 5: retain only last 3 elements of a sparse array collection: 
    
        final SparseArray<String> array = new SparseArray<String>();

        // Fill with values...

        AndroidCollections.iterate(array).only().last(3).retain();
Example 6: replace the value of the elements with an even key with lowercase text: 
    
        final SparseArray<String> array = new SparseArray<String>();

        // Fill with values...

        AndroidCollections.iterate(array).only(new Filter<SparseArrayEntry<String>>() {

                    @Override
                    public boolean matches(final SparseArrayEntry<String> entry, final int count,
                            final int index) {

                        return ((entry.getKey() & 0x1) == 0);
                    }
                }).replaceValues(new Translator<String, String>() {

                    @Override
                    public String translate(final String value) {

                        return value.toLowerCase();
                    }
                });
